DataElement.preferredName: Spinal And/Or Brain Magnetic Resonance Imaging Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not a magnetic resonance imaging of the spine and or brain was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Spinal And/Or Brain Magnetic Resonance Imaging Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the spine or spinal cord._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium._Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Spinal And/Or Brain Magnetic Resonance Imaging
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Spinal; of or relating to the spine or spinal cord.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:That part of the central nervous system contained within the cranium, comprising the prosencephalon, mesencephalon, and rhombencephalon. It is derived from the anterior part of the embryonic neural tube. Functions include muscle control and coordination, sensory reception and integration, speech production, memory storage, and the elaboration of thought and emotions.:Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the spine or spinal cord.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
